--------------------
<Text: Rabbi Jonathan (Hebrew: רבי יונתן, "Rabi Yonatan") was a "tanna" of the 2nd century and schoolfellow of R. Josiah, apart from whom he is rarely quoted.
Triplets:<Rabbi Jonathan
1:
--------------------
<Text: Rabbi Jonathan:  Jonathan is generally so cited without further designation; but there is ample reason for identifying him with the less frequently occurring Jonathan (or Nathan) b. Joseph (or "Jose"; comp.]

Triplets:<Rabbi Jonathan
3:
--------------------
Text: Rabbi Jonathan:  , Yitro, Baḥodesh, 10, with Sifre, Deut.
Triplets:<Rabbi Jonathan
